newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's VSM says plans 200 bln rbls bonds.
newsitem.headline: Russia's VSM says plans 200 bln rbls bonds.

text.p: Russia's RAO Vysokoskorostnye Magistrali (VSM or High-Speed Railways) plans to issue a 200 billion rouble federal government-backed bond in autumn, a company official said on Tuesday.
VSM has already made three bond issues to raise funds to build a high-speed railway between Moscow and St Petersburg.
VSM has already issued 510 billion roubles worth of bonds, which are Russia's only government-backed corporate paper. The government owns most of the company.
The securities are effectively the same as Russian OFZ interest-bearing bonds. Like OFZ bonds, they pay quarterly interest linked to yields on current issues of GKO discount Treasury bills.
Environmentalists oppose the multi-billion dollar project as the route is supposed to cross several national parks.
